item.title: Gradient Descent in Logistic Regression
item.description: Table of Contents HAHAHUGOSHORTCODE-TOC0-HBHB Problem Formulation There are commonly two ways of formulating the logistic regression problem, depending on the way we label the response variable $y$. Here we focus on the first formulation and defer the second formulation on the appendix. First Formulation: Consider restrict $y$ to {${-1,1}$}. Then we have $$ \begin{aligned} &\mathbb{P}(y=1|z)=\sigma(z)=\frac{1}{1 + e^{-z}} &\mathbb{P}(y=-1|z)=\sigma(z)=\frac{1}{1 + e^z}, \end{aligned} $$ which can be compactly written as $$ \mathbb{P}(y|z)=\sigma(zy).
